content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Coal Mining Operation at (-14.0, 23.0)
- Burner mining drill at (-14.0, 23.0) connected to wooden chest at (-14.5, 21.5)
- Currently mining iron ore with 602 iron ore stored in chest

### Coal Mining Operation at (24.0, -15.0)
- Burner mining drill at (24.0, -15.0) connected to wooden chest at (23.5, -16.5)
- Currently mining coal with 88 coal stored in chest

### Copper Processing Line at (20.0, 20.0)
Consists of following entities:
- Burner mining drill at (20.0, 20.0) mining copper ore
- Three wooden chests in sequence:
  - Initial chest at (20.5, 21.5) with 5 copper ore
  - Middle chest at (22.5, 21.5) with 397 copper ore
  - Output chest at (24.5, 17.5) with 53 copper plates
- Stone furnace at (24.0, 20.0)
- Three burner inserters:
  - First inserter at (21.5, 21.5) moving ore between initial and middle chest
  - Second inserter at (23.5, 21.5) moving ore from middle chest to furnace
  - Third inserter at (24.5, 18.5) moving processed plates from furnace to output chest

### Unused Furnaces
- Two stone furnaces at (-11.0, 20.0) and (-9.0, 20.0) without active production

ERROR TIPS

### Inserter Placement and Orientation Issues
- Ensure inserters are properly oriented to pick up from source and drop to destination
- Check that inserter drop and pickup positions align with connected entities

### Furnace Operation Issues
- Furnaces showing "no ingredients to smelt" warning - ensure proper item flow through inserters
- Monitor fuel levels in burner devices to maintain continuous operation

### Resource Flow Optimization
- Large amount of copper ore (397) accumulated in middle chest suggests possible bottleneck in processing line
- Consider balancing mining speed with processing capacity
